title:
Using Palantir's Q2 2024 earnings release, calculate the company's Adjusted EBITDA for the quarter. Begin with GAAP operating income, then adjust for:
 Depreciation & Amortization
 Stock-based compensation
 Employer payroll taxes related to stock-based compensation
 Exclude any other non-recurring items not listed. Provide the final figure in $M, rounded to two decimal places.
description: The calculation of Palantir's Adjusted EBITDA for Q2 2024 needs GAAP operating income data which can be found in the company's quarterly financial statements. The Q2 2024 earnings release shows operating income reached $105.339 million during the three-month period which ended on June 30 2024. The reconciliation table shows depreciation and amortization expenses amount to $8.056 million during this time period. The non-GAAP adjustments section of the report shows stock-based compensation expenses at $141.764 million for the quarter. The reconciliation table shows $6.464 million worth of employer payroll taxes from stock-based compensation. The calculation of Q2 2024 Adjusted EBITDA requires adding all GAAP operating income adjustments to reach $261.623 million which becomes $261.62 million after rounding.

rubric.criteria: Uses GAAP operating income of $105.339 million
States the operating income pertains to the three-month period ended June 30, 2024
Includes depreciation and amortization of $8.056 million
Includes employer payroll taxes related to stock-based compensation of $6.464 million
Starts the Adjusted EBITDA calculation from GAAP operating income and adds the listed adjustments
Reports an unrounded Adjusted EBITDA total of $261.623 million
Reports a final rounded Adjusted EBITDA of $261.62 million (2 decimal points of precision)
Uses only the listed adjustments and does not include any other non-recurring items
